summary: An ordinance accepting the surrender by the Seattle Lighting Company, a franchise granted by Ordinance No. 465, of the City of Ballard, Washington, on August 27, 1901, and accepting the surrender of a franchise granted by the City of Georgetown, Washington, by Ordinance No. 291, on June 19, 1909, and authorize the surrender of the bonds given under and in pursuance of the terms of said ordinances, saving and protecting the rights of the Seattle Lighting Company heretofore acquired under and by virtue of the provisions of said ordinances, and authorize the return to said Seattle Lighting Company the sum of $250.00 deposited by it under the terms and provisions of Ordinance No. 465 of the City of Ballard.
